DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare two therapeutic procedures in the treatment of isolated varicosis of the anterior accessory great saphenous vein (AAGSV): crossectomy and avulsion of the varicose AAGSV versus foam sclerotherapy of the AAGSV.
DOC.brief_title: Surgery Versus Sclerotherapy for Isolated Accessory Great Saphenous Vein Varicosis
DOC.criteria: reflux in anterior accessory great saphenous vein (AAGSV) > 0,5 sek concomitant reflux in great saphenous vein (GSV) reflux in the deep venous system (postthrombotic syndrome) acute thrombosis hypercoagulability allergy to aethoxysclerol or local anesthetics immobility open foramen ovale bacterial infection of the skin pregnancy and breast feeding peripheral arterial occlusive disease III, IV (PAOD)
